@think_or_swim True for EU; but Irish AQ stems from domestic waste burnt in biomass stoves. Traffic AQ reduces to background150m from busy streets. Tackle boilers/burning first, then PM2.5s from common rail diesel? Demonizing diesel increases CO2, use NCT to tax dirty vehicles, but prioritise?

@lindat2957 @Mick__geek Diesel combustion efficiency = less CO2/km. Only very latest GDI petrol match diesel. Diesel is better for planet, petrol/gas for our health. I vote with planet, otherwise it won't matter what we drive. Trend towards SUV is negating both. See https://t.co/vRxNnac4Jl for TOe/NCV

@odowdjb @DublinTransport Thin routes can be replaced with shared taxis: better access to services. Good results at https://t.co/wsXd6KASOA A congestion charge will help get more out of their cars on to thinner routes to improve viability, but theres no hope for the that anytime soon.

Point well made @DublinTransport wrt bus numbers. Also agree, it does not matter who operates so long as they do it safely and on time. Its a drivers market now across the EU; DB are well able to compete and win if unions let them.

@humantransit @BusConnects @yascaoimhin Agreed and latest graphics explain the spines well. But how will NTA make buses arrive spaced out? Biggest frustration / cause of bus non-use is unreliability: We have enough buses, drivers and demand, but no confidence in bus being there when planned - despite years of RTPI

@odowdjb @BusConnects @humantransit @yascaoimhin @TFIupdates @dublinbusnews @dermotog Hi James, I think DB fight their corner very well. Their challenge is the 'No Change Ever' barriers put up by unions (see NBRU on Busconnects, Dart freq, ditto RTPI). Lets see how the spines work out; #7 is much improved since omitting Sallynoggin Village. eBuses testing 2019.
